1.title: Ho Ho Snowman
1.plot: Henry sees plenty of fun activities taking place in the snowy winter weather.

2.title: Percy the Snowman
2.plot: Percy is sad so Thomas decides to share his winter special with his best friend.

3.title: Diesel Works Christmas Tree
3.plot: Thomas locates the perfect tree for the diesels on Misty Island.

4.title: Salty Surprise
4.plot: Edward inadvertently gives Salty the best Christmas present of all - a new story to tell.

5.title: Emily's Winter Party Special
5.plot: Emily finds the Fat Controller's missing top-hat.

6.title: The Blue Mountain Quarry Christmas Tree
6.plot: Toby and Rheneas find the perfect Christmas tree for the Blue Mountain Quarry on Misty Island.

7.title: Slippy Sodor
7.plot: Thomas needs a new funnel, but the only suitable one at the Steamworks makes him look very silly indeed.

8.title: Tickled Pink
8.plot: James is painted pink and keeps hiding from his friends. He soon realises that doing his special job is more important that his pride.

9.title: Henry's Good Deeds
9.plot: Inspired by Thomas, Henry wants to do some good deeds.

10.title: Snow Tracks
10.plot: Gordon fetches Rocky when Thomas gets derailed in the snow. Gordon then helps his little tank engine friend with his very important job.

11.title: Steamy Sodor
11.plot: Thomas is running the Steamworks while Victor is away, but he doesn't listen to anyone and ends up in a terrible mess.

12.title: The Run Away Kite
12.plot: Thomas is reluctant to let his friends help him chase the children's runaway kite until his firebox fizzles out.

13.title: Unhappy Hiro
13.plot: Hiro is homesick so Thomas tries to cheer him up, but he doesn't understand that Hiro is an older engine and doesn't like to do the same things that he does.

14.title: Happy Hiro
14.plot: After he introduces Hiro to the Logging Locos, Thomas realises his mistake and decides to puff quietly with Hiro to make him happy again.

15.title: Sodor United Game Day
15.plot: Thomas is to decide which engine does which job on the day of the Sodor United football match. Emily is so busy boasting that she doesn't get the job she wants.

16.title: James Transports the Sodor United Fans
16.plot: Not happy with her own job, Emily asks James if she can help with his and almost causes a nasty accident.

17.title: Percy Tries to Make New Friends
17.plot: Percy tries to make friends with some woodland animals, but they run away from him.

18.title: Gordon Scares Percy
18.plot: After being scared by big Gordon, Percy realises that he had scared the woodland animals away by being noisy. Percy decides to try a gentler approach.

19.title: Percy's New Friends
19.plot: By being gentle, Percy is able to befriend all the woodland animals.

20.title: Where is Sodor United's Washing?
20.plot: Being too busy looking for a more important job to help with, Emily hasn't delivered the washing to the laundry lady and now the football team have nothing to wear for their match.

21.title: Sodor United is Dressed and Ready!
21.plot: Emily takes the football kits to the laundry lady to be washed. They come back soaking wet, but Emily has an idea.

22.title: Collecting the Jobi Wood
22.plot: Thomas and Edward are sent to Misty Island to collect Jobi logs. The Logging Locos think they will need their help, but Thomas is sure he can manage.

23.title: Edward the Rescue Engine
23.plot: Edward is to be a rescue engine for the day, but he is worried because he doesn't know how to be a hero like Harold the Helicopter.

24.title: Edward Helps Farmer McColl's Dog
24.plot: Edward finds Famer McColl's dog beside the line. By being gentle, he is able to take the frightened dog back to her owner.

25.title: Edward Becomes a Hero
25.plot: As he puffs along, everyone calls Edward a hero. Edward is confused by this; he doesn't feel like a hero.

26.title: Edward the Hero
26.plot: Edward discovers that he can be a hero by just being himself.

27.title: Thomas & Edward Arrive at Misty Island
27.plot: Edward finds Misty Island very strange and ends up getting stuck on the Shake Shake Bridge.

28.title: Percy's Bad Luck
28.plot: Everything is going wrong for Percy; he is having a very unlucky day.

29.title: Thomas Works with the Logging Locos
29.plot: Thomas finally admits defeat and fetches the Logging Locos to help him put things right and collect the Jobi wood on Misty Island.

30.title: Percy's Lucky Charm
30.plot: Stephen gives Percy his lucky horseshoe, but Percy doesn't notice it fall off. When he finds Ben in danger, he doesn't think he can help without his charm to bring him luck.

31.title: Percy Discovers His Own Luck
31.plot: After rescuing Bill and Ben, Percy realises that he doesn't need a lucky charm, he just has to work hard, be really useful and the luck will come.

32.title: Stafford Learns How to Be a Steamie
32.plot: Stafford wants to make some steam engine noises to impress the children so Thomas and Percy agree to teach him.

33.title: Kevin is Sent to Brendam Docks
33.plot: There is too much work for Cranky at Brendam Docks, so the Fat Controller arranges for Kevin to give him a helping hook.

34.title: Gordon's Boiler is Hit!
34.plot: A stone from Paxton's trucks hits Gordon's boiler, but the big engine doesn't want to have it checked over and carries on with the express.

35.title: Paxton & Thomas Over the Bumpy Track
35.plot: Thomas and Paxton have fun on a stretch of bumpy track until disaster strikes.

36.title: Stafford Finds Farmer McColl's Lambs
36.plot: Stafford frightens Farmer McColl's lambs away with his loud steam engine noises. He has to find them by being quiet.

37.title: Kevin Meets Cranky
37.plot: Kevin arrives at Brendam Docks to give Cranky a helping hook, but Cranky is still adamant that he doesn't need any help.

38.title: Gordon's Dry Boiler
38.plot: Due to a puncture on his boiler, Gordon has to keep stopping to take on water, but this makes him late.

39.title: Thomas Lost His Puff!
39.plot: Paxton goes looking for Thomas' "lost puff".

40.title: Quiet Stafford, The Electric Engine
40.plot: Stafford realises that he is happy being himself - a quiet electric engine.

41.title: Two Hooks Are Better Than One
41.plot: Cranky gets Kevin out of trouble with the Fat Controller and allows him to carry on working at the docks.

42.title: Gordon Runs Out of Steam
42.plot: Gordon's boiler finally runs dry and he has to let Paxton shunt him to the Steamworks.

43.title: Thomas Finds His Puff
43.plot: Paxton learns that "puff" is just another word for "steam" and feels foolish.

44.title: The Tale of the Phantom Express
44.plot: It's Percy's first ever mail run to Ulfstead Castle. James tries to frighten Percy with a tale about the Phantom Express that haunts the castle.

45.title: The Great Western Way
45.plot: Thomas and Duck have to take Harold by rail to the Sodor Search and Rescue Centre. Thomas wants to show Harold some sights, but Duck wants to do things the Great Western way.

46.title: Is Thomas Slowing Down?
46.plot: Bertie reveals why he's managed to beat Thomas to the level crossing everyday lately.

47.title: Wobbly Winston
47.plot: All the engines laugh at Winston for the way the Fat Controller drives him.

48.title: Who is The Phantom Express?
48.plot: James pretends to be the Phantom Express and scares Stephen and Percy, causing them to fall into the castle's dry moat.

49.title: Thomas Plays a Trick on Duck
49.plot: Eager to show Harold the sights of Sodor from the ground, Thomas tricks Duck into going to Knapford Station, but it almost ends in disaster.

50.title: Thomas Creates a Shortcut
50.plot: Thomas tries to find a shortcut on his branch line so that he can finally beat Bertie to the level crossing again.

51.title: Winston is on the Loose!
51.plot: Winston doesn't remind the Fat Controller to put his brake on and is soon having a great time rolling down the line without a driver.

52.title: The Ghost Hunt
52.plot: James and the Fat Controller go looking for the Phantom Express around Ulfstead Castle and find Percy and Stephen who are still in the dry moat.

53.title: Three Ways of Doing Things
53.plot: Duck concludes that there might be three ways of doing things; the Great Western way, the wrong way and the Thomas way.

54.title: Thomas is Back on the Branch Line
54.plot: While looking for a shortcut, Thomas derails and Bertie has to take his passengers. In future, Thomas decides to stick to his regular route.

55.title: The Fat Controller is Back in the Driving Seat
55.plot: Winston is no longer enjoying rolling around without a driver. Luckily, he runs out of petrol just in time to avoid a nasty collision.

56.title: Thomas' Lost Snow Plow
56.plot: Thomas tricks his driver into removing his snowplough. When it snows, Thomas has to stay in his warm shed while Emily clears the branch line for him.

57.title: The Frozen Turntable at Tidmouth Sheds
57.plot: The turntable at Tidmouth Sheds is frozen solid so the engines have to look for other sheds to sleep in.

58.title: Who Took the Steamies' Decorations?
58.plot: Diesel 10 wants some Christmas decorations for the Dieselworks, so he decides to take some from Tidmouth Sheds.

59.title: Winston is Santa's Sleigh!
59.plot: The Fat Controller is to play Santa Claus at a Christmas party and is to have his own sleigh. The Fat Controller isn't best pleased about this and decides to convert Winston instead.

60.title: The Search for Thomas' Snowplough
60.plot: Thomas gets bored in the shed and decides to go and get his snowplough back. Unfortunately, the snow has hidden it and Thomas can't find it anywhere.

61.title: Gordon is Stuck in Tidmouth Sheds!
61.plot: Gordon selfishly takes the one available berth at Tidmouth Sheds. The next morning, the workmen budge the frozen turntable and Gordon ends up getting stuck inside the shed.

62.title: The Fat Controller's Sleigh Arrives!
62.plot: Thomas delivers the Fat Controller's sleigh to Ulfstead Castle and he is not particularly pleased with it.

63.title: Thomas is Stuck in the Snow!
63.plot: Without his snowplough, Thomas gets stuck in the snow. Fortunately, Emily comes along and saves the day.

64.title: How Diesel 10 Stole Christmas
64.plot: Diesel 10 gets caught stealing decorations and is soon being chased across the island by the entire Steam Team.

65.title: How Sidney Got His Wheels
65.plot: Percy arranges a very special Christmas present for Sidney.

66.title: Thomas Saves Santa's Sleigh!
66.plot: The Fat Controller ends up sliding down the track, out of control, in his sleigh. Thomas gives chase and is able to save the day.

67.title: The Tables Have Turned for Gordon
67.plot: As he has spent all day in the shed, the Fat Controller makes Gordon take Percy's mail train.

68.title: Harvey the Crane Engine
68.plot: Harvey is a strange looking crane engine and frequently the subject of Bill and Ben's teasing.

69.title: Sodor's Two Fire Engines
69.plot: The Fat Controller brings some inspectors to the Search and Rescue Centre to see Flynn and Belle. Initially, the inspectors are not sure that Sodor needs two fire engines.

70.title: Salty's Love for the Sea
70.plot: Salty isn't feeling well, but he doesn't want to be checked over as he is worried he'll be reassigned to quarry work again. He is even more concerned when a new engine called Porter arrives at the docks.

71.title: Troublesome Diesel
71.plot: Diesel sneakily couples himself to Hiro's train to show the old engine just how troublesome trucks can be.

72.title: Harvey and His Engine
72.plot: Harvey tries something out of his comfort zone when he volunteers to take a train of flatbeds to Vicarstown.

73.title: Fiery Flynn and Belle
73.plot: Flynn begins to think that the Fat Controller might only need one fire engine when Belle beats him to a fire at Arlesdale End.

74.title: Salty Sets Sail Back to the Docks
74.plot: Salty is repaired at the Dieselworks and, in his haste to return to the docks, runs into a flatbed of oil drums.

75.title: Master of the Railway
75.plot: The Fat Controller makes Diesel learn how to handle trucks from Hiro, the Master of the Railway.

76.title: Fiery Flynn to the Rescue!
76.plot: With Belle busy elsewhere and a fire to extinguish at Brendam Docks, Flynn learns that you can never have too many fire engines.

77.title: Harvey, The Really Useful Engine
77.plot: Harvey has an accident while hauling his load of pipes, but unlike the other engines, Harvey can clean up his own mess.

78.title: James' Scary Stories
78.plot: To prove he isn't scared of his own scary stories, the engines challenge James to pull the Flying Kipper for Henry. James accepts, but changes his mind when he smells the fishy train.

79.title: Stephen, The Rocket
79.plot: Stephen wants to prove to Spencer that he is the fastest afternoon tea express there ever was.

80.title: The Bad Coal Delivery
80.plot: Hiro and Henry take on bad coal. Henry decides to go back to the shed, but Hiro thinks they should keep on puffing.

81.title: Luke Meets the Young Deer
81.plot: Luke befriends a young deer who has found its way to the busy and noisy Blue Mountain Quarry.

82.title: Luke & Millie
82.plot: Millie and Luke are both narrow gauge engines with very different jobs. They decide to swap duties for the day.

83.title: James is Scared of the Smelly Fish!
83.plot: James gets Henry into trouble and the Fat Controller makes James take the smelly Flying Kipper train instead that night.

84.title: Stephen, The Rocket Again
84.plot: Stephen gets different engines to push him so that he can be fast again. One day, no other engines are around so Stephen has to ask Spencer.

85.title: Hiro Keeps on Puffing
85.plot: Hiro delivers his load to Brendam Docks even though he is burning bad coal. The Fat Controller gives him another job, but he'll need Henry's help.

86.title: The Quarry is No Place for a Deer
86.plot: In an effort to accommodate Luke's deer at the quarry, the machines and engines try to work more quietly.

87.title: Luke & Millie Switch Jobs
87.plot: Luke and Millie learn a lot while doing each others' work, but are glad to go back to normal at the end of the day.

88.title: James and the Fish at Tidmouth Sheds
88.plot: James delivers all the fish, but when he wakes up the next morning, he doesn't notice that he still has a stinky fish on his bufferbeam.

89.title: The Afternoon Tea Tour
89.plot: Stephen's need for speed results in the Earl, the Fat Controller and Lady Hatt getting into a right jam.

90.title: Henry Keeps on Puffing
90.plot: Henry keeps on pushing the heavy flatbeds and a broken-down Hiro all the way to Brendam Docks.

91.title: Luke's Deer Friend Finds His Home
91.plot: Luke's deer friend finds its mother in the grounds of Ulfstead Castle.

92.title: Dirty Scruff
92.plot: The Fat Controller orders a rusty Scruff to be repainted and the scruffy engine isn't happy about it.

93.title: Caitlin's Night on the Island of Sodor
93.plot: Caitlin has to spend the night on Sodor and ends up taking Percy's mail train. Unfortunately, she forgets that everyone else is trying to sleep and wakes up most of the island.

94.title: Charlie the Comedic, Purple Engine
94.plot: After telling jokes about elephants all day, Charlie meets a real live one beside the railway line.

95.title: Bill or Ben?
95.plot: Bill and Ben think Connor is very full of himself and they decide to play a trick on him.

96.title: The New, Stylish Scruff
96.plot: Scruff is so impressed by his make-over that he decides to look for a cleaner job.

97.title: Caitlin Up All Night
97.plot: Caitlin begins to wonder if staying up all night had been such a good idea after all.

98.title: The Engine That Cried Elephant
98.plot: No-one will believe Charlie when he tells them that he has seen an elephant.

99.title: Connor Meets Bill and Ben
99.plot: Connor finally realises that he has been tricked by Bill and Ben and the Fat Controller is not at all happy.

100.title: Scruff, The Really Useful Engine
100.plot: Scruff decides that he would rather be a really useful engine than a really shiny one any day.

101.title: Charlie Rescues the Elephant
101.plot: After rescuing the elephant, Charlie doesn't want to be ignored again and vows never to tell another joke. However, that decision doesn't last long.

102.title: Bill and Ben's New Colour
102.plot: Ben tricks Kevin into having himself repainted to match Bill's colour again. Afterwards, the two engines decide to trick Connor again.

103.title: Stuck on Gordon's Hill
103.plot: Gordon gets stuck on his hill and Edward is called in to give him a push.

104.title: Diesel's Disappearing Joke
104.plot: Diesel gets all the other diesels to hide from Paxton for a joke, but Paxton gets quite worried that he can't find any of his friends.

105.title: Gordon Learns His Lesson
105.plot: Thomas tricks Gordon to teach him a lesson. As a result, Gordon ends up getting stuck on the hill again and has to ask Edward for help.

106.title: Henry is Haunted by the Flatbeds of Fear
106.plot: Henry thinks he can hear the Flatbeds of Fear. He goes onto a siding and refuses to move.

107.title: Toad Saves the Day!
107.plot: Toad bravely manages to prevent a nasty accident.

108.title: Duck's Rocky Rescue
108.plot: James' impatience causes Rocky to knock over a signal on the way to rescuing Duck.

109.title: Where is Toby's Signal?
109.plot: Toby is confused by the many signals at Knapford Junction.

110.title: Toby's Red Signal
110.plot: Toby gets his signals right even when the signals are wrong.

111.title: Toad's Great Adventure
111.plot: Toad impresses all the engines in the shunting yard with the tale of his eventful day.

112.title: Duck and the Great Western Slip Coaches
112.plot: Duck tells the engines about summer on the Great Western Railway and the special slip coaches he used to pull which can be uncoupled without stopping.

113.title: Marion and the Leaky Water Pipe
113.plot: Marion accidentally breaks a water pipe and tries to cover it up.

114.title: Thomas the Quarry Engine Challenge
114.plot: Thomas is left in charge of the quarry while Diesel and Mavis deliver some trucks to Brendam Docks.

115.title: Duck Saves the Day for the Slip Coaches
115.plot: The Slip Coaches refuse to carry on being pulled by James who doesn't know how to use them. Luckily, Duck comes along and saves the day.

116.title: Thomas and the Birdwatcher Emergency
116.plot: A birdwatcher accidentally damages Annie when he pulls the emergency cable after hearing a rare bird.

117.title: Thomas Tries to Pull the Troublesome Trucks
117.plot: Thomas decides to take some very Troublesome Trucks on his own without waiting for a back engine. Disaster soon strikes.

118.title: Duncan is Grumpy, Just Like His Passenger
118.plot: Grumpy Duncan has an even more grumpy passenger on board.

119.title: Connor and the Last Train
119.plot: Connor wants to get everyone home for Christmas, but the Fat Controller has an announcement that might stop the last train.

120.title: Duncan Doesn't Like the Humming of Christmas Songs
120.plot: Duncan tries to be cheerful all day, but some humming passengers tests his patience.

121.title: Duncan Changes His Grumpy Ways
121.plot: Duncan realises that he must put the needs of the majority of his passengers over the demands of his one grumpy passenger.

122.title: Emily and the Sodor Snow
122.plot: Emily struggles to clear the snow from the tracks at Vicarstown. Luckily, help is at hand.

123.title: Percy Cheers Reg Up for the Holiday Season
123.plot: Percy worries that Reg is missing out on the magic of Christmas being stuck at the scrapyard.

124.title: James and the Blunders of Impatience
124.plot: James realises that his impatience has consequences.

125.title: Percy Misses Gator
125.plot: Percy can't help but think about his friend Gator, who has gone back to his home overseas, which makes him sad.

126.title: Percy's Perfect Christmas Gift
126.plot: Reg makes a Christmas tree from scrap and even has a gift for Percy.

127.title: Marion and the Water Pipe Repairs
127.plot: The burst water pipe causes a landslide and a rock ends up blocking the main line. Can Marion clear it before Gordon thunders by with the express?

128.title: Percy and Gator's Advice Rescue the Troublesome Trucks
128.plot: The Troublesome Trucks run into an old mine. Percy is too scared to go inside to fetch them until he remembers Gator's advice.

129.title: Bill and Ben Cause Trouble for Marion
129.plot: The claypits are running out of coal, thanks to Bill and Ben's antics.

130.title: Sir Topham Hatt Gives His Engines a Second Chance
130.plot: After a day of chaos the visiting Deputy Minister suggests that the Fat Controller give his engines a second chance to show how well the railway can run.

imdb.title: Thomas & Friends: Clips (UK)
plot: Uploaded to the UK Thomas and Friends YouTube Channel every week, these fun clips let you relive some of Thomas' most memorable moments.::Anonymous
